title: How To Get Started With A Plant-based Diet
summary: Many people who eat a 100% plant-based diet consume an unbalanced amount of carbohydrates and fibre while not getting enough protein and vitamins from plants. It’s very easy to fall into the trap of eating mostly refined carbohydrates like bread and pasta, which aren’t the best sources of nutrients. You can begin by eliminating animal products from your diet one at a time, or by cutting out all animal products at once. If you want to take it slow, start by replacing one product a week with a vegan alternative.
